content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: TXPARMCD
      operator: equal_to
      value: TRTDOS
    - name: TXVAL
      operator: not_matches_regex
      value: '[+-]?([0-9]*[.])?[0-9]+$'
    - name: TXVAL
      operator: not_matches_regex
      # see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44374088/regex-to-match-comma-separated-numbers-or-stop-full-match-only
      value: ^(\s*-?\d+(\.\d+)?)(\s*,\s*-?\d+(\.\d+)?)*$
    - name: TXVAL
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: SEE PROTOCOL
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.240
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: The value of TRTDOS is either a number, a semicolon-delimited string
  containing numbers without spaces, or "SEE PROTOCOL" for more complex dosing regimens.
Outcome:
  Message: The value of TXVAL for TXPARMCD=TRTDOS is neither a number, a semicolon-delimited
    string containing numbers without spaces, or "SEE PROTOCOL"
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '240'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Numeric representation of the planned test article
                  dose level. For dose levels that vary over time within a set, a
                  semicolon-delimited string without spaces can be used (e.g., 100;150;7).
                  For more complex dosing regimens, sponsor should enter "SEE PROTOCOL".
                Document: IG v3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 7.4.2
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - TRIAL DESIGN
  Domains:
    Include:
      - TX

json.Description: The value of TRTDOS is either a number, a semicolon-delimited string containing numbers without spaces, or "SEE PROTOCOL" for more complex dosing regimens.

Outcome.Message: The value of TXVAL for TXPARMCD=TRTDOS is neither a number, a semicolon-delimited string containing numbers without spaces, or "SEE PROTOCOL"

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Numeric representation of the planned test article dose level. For dose levels that vary over time within a set, a semicolon-delimited string without spaces can be used (e.g., 100;150;7). For more complex dosing regimens, sponsor should enter "SEE PROTOCOL".
